This small community bookstore in Mesa, Arizona started out of the garages of the twins in late 2009. They started selling books online as a hobbie, selling educational tools for teachers and students on Amazon. What began as a few boxes in the corner of their garages, soon grew to mountains of books taking up the space that used to house a few family cars. Their wives Daniella and Monica, seeing the hobby grow and grow, convinced Adam and Donovan to open a brick and mortar store in the fall of 2010.The small community bookstore offers not only new and used books, but DVD's, CD's, Blu-Ray, Audio Books, Video Games, Board Games, Lego, Action Figures, and Collectibles. We buy - sell - and trade! We are located in the Walmart parking lot between Gamestop and Cold Stone Creamery on Signal Butte and the US 60. Look at our website at www.bookrackonline.com or call us at 480-380-0044.

summary: Adam majored in Film Studies at the University of Utah and worked with movie distribution for Harkins Theatres throughout Arizona. He was instrumental in opening several huge multi-plex theatres in new regions for the company, worked as a liaison during special screenings, and won company awards in marketing and management.  During this time he was instrumental in personally facilitating visits by Academy Award winners Tom Hanks and Jodie Foster, as well as the cast of Wolverine, Tom Cruise, Bruce Campbell, Greg Kinnear, the Wayans Bros and directors, Tony and Ridley Scott, Randall Wallace, Kevin Smith and Garry Marshall. Adam, along with his twin brother Donovan, formed a production company in 2004 and have produced and directed films which were screened in over 40 film festivals across the country. They won over 20 awards for their films and screenplays, and several of the films have aired on TV. Donovan and Adam won a Rocky Mountain Emmy® Award for "Reveille" on October 6th, 2007. He has written, optioned and produced several screenplays.For many years, Adam has specialized in directing, writing and producing a plethora of programs in classic and new media. He specializes in providing a cinematic storytelling experience for advertisers/brand marketers that want to reach their audience in a new and effective way. Some highlights include a 30 minute interview with New York Best Selling Author J.A. Jance, a viral public service announcement for battered women, a10-minute short film about military veterans that was viewed over 6 million times on Google and the release of an informative children’s book called, “Dream” that included a book tour where he spoke to elementary schools throughout Arizona about the importance making your dreams come true. Adam is currently married to an amazing woman, has two amazing boys, and a cat that visits when she wants.
